intro: Faramea colombiana, commonly known as the Colombian faramea, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its woody stems and dense foliage. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by red or orange berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
